title: Plate, "Land for the Working People", 1919
markings: On underside: hammer, sickle, cog, 1919 hand-painted in blue overglaze
provenance: The Henry and Ludmilla Shapiro Collection. Mrs. Shapiro acquired this plate from a former girlfriend of Natan Altman.
creditline: The Henry and Ludmilla Shapiro Collection; Partial gift and partial purchase through the Decorative Arts Association Acquisition and Smithsonian Collections Acquisition Program Funds
description: Circular, green ground with red lettering and image; in the center a lozenge with sickle, wheat sheaf, stylized factory; around the border the slogan in Russian, "Land for the Working People."

tombstone.epitaph:
Plate, "Land for the Working People", 1919.
1919. Porcelain, enamel. The Henry and Ludmilla Shapiro Collection; Partial gift and partial purchase through the Decorative Arts Association Acquisition and Smithsonian Collections Acquisition Program Funds. 1989-41-9.
